Assessment/Recommendations:
69 y.o. male with obesity, BMI = 35 -> 32/33, with known complications as listed above. Causes of this patient's obesity include genetic predisposition, past medications (prednisone, antidepressants?), emotional/compulsive/binge-like eating related to manic phase of bipolar illness.
Pt continuing comprehensive program of individualized nutritional education addressing meal structuring, portion control, food choices, etc. and psychological counseling addressing emotional contributors to eating and weight gain. Seeing Paul Edwards RD, and Allison Ng, PhD. Lost 18# in 4 months (1 pound a week) so far with nutritional change, exercise. Commended pt on success.
Pt will continue exercise (walks 4 mi/d, gym 2 (going to 3) times a week for an hour, swimming).
Because of the afternoon period he describes as being like a "Warewolf" (4-7 pm), I recommended he use this time for exercise rather than for his other, more sedentary, activities.
At a later time we can consider medication (in this case, orlistat). Currently progress is excellent without needing it.
Discuss elevated BP with PCP, may need higher dose of ACEI.
F/U w/ me 2 - 2.5 mos.
